Comments_List: I learned how to critically analyze literary texts, especially poetic ones. Also, writing skills.

-understanding of modern literature
-understanding of the growth of literary styles from ancient times to the present
-ability to critically speed read
I learned how to write a more concise literary intervention.
Literature analysis skills, literature essay writing skills, and knowledge about major literary texts in the Western canon.

This is a great course. The instruction could see improvement, but overall a very interesting course. Some books were too long and could have been replaced with others, but still very instructional. One large issue is the heavy variance in the quality of the course based on the instructor, as not all classes are equal.

Primary weakness: No rigorous discussion
Primary strength: Teacher who is very willing to help

I think the selection and distribution of books could have been improved. I think we should start the semester with Don Quijote so we have time to read it over break. And maybe fit in another Shakespeare?
Ya its DS. its hard but worth

I would recommend this course, because DS was overall a very beneficial experience. However, the teacher one receives significantly affects the quality of the course and should be taken into heavy consideration when choosing classes.
No. The discussion was largely lead by the teacher and often hard to follow, but also well planned
